result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Davari L Weaver

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Davari L Weaver in court.  Attorney Robert Buckett in court for Davari L Weaver.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Reading of info waived; NG plea entered.  Counsel expects resolution which is contingent upon up-front payment of restitution.  Adj requested.  Court admonishes def re payment of restitution.
Hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
E-mailed Complaint to Global HR Research per request & payment rec'd 9-21-22

Defendant Davari L Weaver in court.  Attorney Robert Buckett in court for Davari L Weaver.  Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel's first appearance. Def waives preliminary hearing.  Court questions def, accepts waiver, and binds def over; State to file Information.
Arraignment scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:15 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No contact with Wash Co. Walmart Stores

Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Davari L Weaver in court. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Def referred to SPD (slip provided).  Court sets $500 signature bond.  Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing; Court accepts.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing and to appear w/an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Initial appearance on August 1, 2022 at 09:45 am.
